We are a hybrid, remote-friendly culture, with our company headquarters based in San Francisco. Candidates anywhere in the US are encouraged to apply.About Us:Ambience Healthcare is building the AI operating system for healthcare, with the mission of supercharging healthcare workers with AI superpowers.Over the past several years, healthcare organizations and health systems have been approaching a critical turning point: workforce shortages and clinician burnout are at an all-time high, cutting into already-razor-thin margins and posing critical operational challenges. Organizations are finding themselves under immense pressure to address burnout and increase access to care, all while maintaining profitability despite declining reimbursement rates.Until now, they have been unable to find any viable solutions to this productivity and morale crisis.Ambience Healthcare was founded after 2.5 years of R&D in large language model (LLM) technology to address one of the most impactful productivity opportunities in healthcare: clinical documentation. The most painful part of a clinician's day consists of hours of late-night administrative work, writing detailed documentation in the medical record for each of their visits. The contents of each medical note are critical for reimbursement, compliance, downstream clinical quality measures, and for other care team members to understand what happened to each patient.Ambience's flagship product, Ambience AutoScribe, is a best-in-class AI medical scribe that captures the nuances of clinician-patient conversation in real-time into comprehensive medical documentation within the EMR. On average, Ambience saves 16+ hours of tedious note-taking per clinician per week. Today, AutoScribe is available across 18+ specialties and is used by clinicians at leading healthcare organizations for every single one of their shifts.For the first time in years, clinicians are able to get home on time for dinner without any documentation homework. And as a result, they now refuse to practice without AutoScribe.As we experience unprecedented pull from the market for our products, we're actively expanding our team of world-class talent across sales, marketing, product, engineering, clinical, and customer success functions.At Ambience, you'll be surrounded by an exceptional team of A-players who are kind, humble, curious, and deeply aligned with the core mission of improving the lives of clinicians and their patients, including:2nd-time founders in healthcare who previously built a virtual care platformthe author of a leading deep learning textbookco-founder of Cruise's ML platform teamco-founder of Rev.com's automated speech recognition teamFormer principal architect at PalantirFounder of Reddit's web platform teamformer Head of Growth from a leading tech-enabled primary care groupThe Role:As a Product Manager—Clinical, your mission is to work closely with our machine learning team to fine-tune AI algorithms that produce high quality, billing-complete documentation that our providers love. You'll also maintain tight feedback loops with providers to identify opportunities for improving the clinical accuracy of our AI systems and ensure that users are saving time on administrative busywork.What You'll Do: Build and maintain strong relationships with key clinical leaders at our customer provider organizationsRedesign customer workflows and support product owners in defining the"minimum lovable product" for each deploymentDrive tight user feedback loops to continually iterate on both product and the quality of our AI models, ensuring that our system addresses the needs of our customersWork closely with engineering to execute on our feature roadmap and improve our machine learning pipelinesSupport product owners in proactively quantifying and communicating the value that Ambience creates to key customer stakeholdersWho You Are: You have a deep understanding of medicine, EMR documentation, workflows, and provider psychology through your experience as a medical scribe or provider (physician, NP, PA, etc.)You have an ability to establish strong relationships with providers and key client stakeholdersYou have an ability to bring a strong scientific and/or engineering mindset to creatively solve problems (experience with software engineering or computer programming is a strong plus)You have an ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writingYou have a demonstrated ability to own execution of ideas from inception through to successful outcomesYou desire to be a part of an ambitious, mission-aligned team that delivers breakthrough product experiences. You are a low-ego team player who prioritizes co-discovering the best ideas, even if they're not your ideasYou value being a kind, encouraging, and supportive teammate to othersYou have a demonstrated ability to thrive in environments with high levels of complexity, uncertainty, and ambiguityNot sure if you meet all of the qualifications? We don't expect every candidate to have done everything listed above, but you should be able to make a credible case that you are ready for the challenge of growing into a new opportunity.Compensation: $80,000-$120,000, with the addition of significant equity.We've intentionally allocated a wider range so that candidates have more flexibility to choose the desired cash/equity split that works for them. Philosophically, we lean towards generous equity grants so that our team truly gets to share in the impact they create.Are you outside of the range? We encourage you to still apply: we take an individualized approach to ensure that compensation accounts for all of the life factors that matter for each candidate.Being at Ambience: An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patientsDedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coachWork alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission alignedOwnership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our companyCompetitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, paid maternity/paternity leave, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) planWe're fortunate to be backed by:Top-tier venture firms: Andreessen Horowitz, Kleiner Perkins, and Human CapitalThe best minds in AI: OpenAI Startup Fund, Jeff Dean, Richard Socher, Pieter Abbeel, AIX Ventures, and othersHealthcare industry leaders: Optum Ventures, Martin Ventures, the Frist family, Randy Parker, Anne Wojcicki, Jay Desai, Nish Bhat, Eren Bali, and others
